reviews.text: Many of the self-service areas were empty, and the food service was very slow!  During the 90-minute dining time, you rarely see a waiter, and after the meal, you have to pay not only the meal cost but also a hefty tip, even though I received almost no service.
Do not trust their height scale for children

Every meal delivers satisfaction from first bite to last. The food was prepared correctly. Workers showed warmth in their service. This place captures neighborhood essence. The employees treated us wonderfully, and I'll return when nearby.
Great price for unlimited hot pot. I will definitely be back.

Good Place.

Love it, itâ€™s a rlly good hotpot especially in queens and I havenâ€™t explored any other hot pot after this one. Iâ€™m not sure if itâ€™s halal or not but I read online it is but still not confirmed

Save your money and donâ€™t come here at all. Iâ€™ve seen cheaper hot pot places that have better quality and variety of ingredients than this. The broths have no flavor whatsoever. I mean isnâ€™t that the basics of hot pot? The broth? I loveâ€¦
If you looking for all you can eat. And basic meat.  I recommend here. I always get the first 1 $21.99 for lunch and dinner $24.99. That is enough for me for vegetarian option. Spicy soup is the best
This place has a very cozy vibe and I love it. The beef tongue was the show stealer. So flavorful with the broth. Double thumbs up :)

It was okay. Service seemed a little bit lacking, pricing was okay for what you get. Not sure I would return.
ä»·æ ¼å¤ªä¾¿å®œäº†
Good all you can eat. They have couple pricing options to pick from.
Good food, good service

This is literally my go-to place for hotpot! My friends and I come here so often that we've honestly eaten so much we're almost sick of it, but we still keep coming back! I think it's incredibly affordable because even when four of us orderâ€¦
A must go!!!

The most disappointing part is the service from the front desk!!
Best value for the price! Excellent service with a very friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Broths are the best. Variety of fresh meat and veggies. Vicky provides us a great service. Iâ€™ll come back for sure.
The best hotpot spot in flushing in my opinion. Best value for price and great food and service.
Great food and service highly recommended!
It was great. Lots of food to a big group of people
Wowâ€¦ love so lovely.
I really like the meatballs in this hot pot restaurant.

Very good value all-you-can-eat hotpot for Flushing! The meat was tasty and fresh, and the buffet portion had lots of fresh veggies and other things to add to your hotpot. The AYCE house special (lowest tier that includes meats) was $29.99 on the weekends, and included soda.

The interior was modern and seemed relatively clean, but itâ€™s a bit dark.

Was in Flushing and craving lamb, so had to swing by Happy Lamb for some hot pot.
They have great AYCE options for diners, offering all kinds of meats, veg, seafood and other sides.  The broth options are limited compared to some places, but both we got were incredibly tasty and fragrent.
The meat was delicious, and the veggies were fresh and clean.  They have ice cream, but you have to ask (we didn't realize), so be sure to leave room!  Overall, great atmosphere and dining experience - will definitely be back!

I came here for dinner and did the AYCE dinner special deal that includes all the meat options for a super affordable price. There were plenty of vegetable options as well for those like me who arenâ€™t big meat lovers. They also had a decent selection of appetizers and desserts. The staff were all attentive and came over to our table often to clear our empty plates.

Realmente querÃ­a cambiar de otro tipo de comida pero no soy muy amantes de este tipo de comida pero no voy a darle una mala opiniÃ³n para el que le guste esta comida es buena el lugar  muy acogedor es solo mi opinion. ğŸ‘ğŸ‘
Reasonable price for AYCE hotpot spot,

I came here twice already and the foods were absolutely delicious! Waiters were patient and there were a decent amount of food options. Different beverages, desserts, and sauces! I highly recommend this place and it's a great deal!
å¥½åƒï¼Œè¿˜ä¸é™é‡ï¼Œæ£’ï¼

Best hotpot place 100000%!!! Service is super kind, broth is actually authentic and the best I have ever had. I love how you can grab as much food as you want to without asking (As long as you donâ€™t waste it). It is also really cheap and totally worth your money. The food is actually always fresh, so everytime Iâ€™m in the area I come here. They have great selections and you wonâ€™t regret coming here!!

Flushing may have more hot pot restaurants per square foot than any other city. Happy Lamb is a safe and solid choice. Their 3 menu options are reasonably priced when compared to the other hyped AYCE Wagyu hot pot places in the area. We opted for the â€œVIPâ€ menu ($36.95) which includes a good variety of meats, although the â€œHouse Specialâ€ menu ($24.95) would do just fine. The buffet section has all of the basics you would expect as well as a few uncommon choices. Service was friendly and efficient.

Stopped in for a quick lunch at this all-you-can-eat hot pot place. The meat was tastyâ€”nothing fancy, but solid for the price. The sauce station had a good variety, and there were plenty of vegetables to choose from. Servers were fast and friendly, which made the experience even better. Great value overall.

Iâ€™ve had this for many years, tried it in different places, and the broth hasnâ€™t changed much. Thereâ€™s nothing really special about it, but itâ€™s a solid option when you feel like having a big meal. They have lots of small dishes and even some desserts. Itâ€™s always been reliable, not the best choice, but something you can count on when you donâ€™t know what to eat.

Update 06/08/25

Still a great place. I got the VIP

End of Update

The food was good. The staff was friendly and attentive. The price was a bit high. I paid $39.14 with tax for the VIP selection. Soda was include which is unusual for an all you can eat.

I got the combo hot pot. The spicy side was easy too much for me. If you like spicy, I'm sure you will enjoy this.

I felt rushed with the 90 minute limit and afraid that if I did not like some food I was trying out, I would get charged the $35 fee. For this I had to take a star off.  But, I will be back.

One of my favorite hotpot spots in Flushing ğŸ”¥ğŸ² @happylambhotpot truly hits the spot every time! They serve an 8-hour slow-cooked bone marrow broth that's rich, comforting, and packed with flavor. Itâ€™s all-you-can-eat hotpot with a premium selection of lamb, Wagyu, seafood, and more â€” all freshly sliced in-house.
With over 100 locations in 11 countries, Happylamb is a global favorite, and the Flushing location is a gem. They even sell their take-home soup kits on Amazon so you can recreate the experience at home!
âœ¨ Unbeatable price, huge variety, and top-notch quality â€” easily the best AYCE hotpot in Flushing. Youâ€™ll love it here as much as I do!

They offer 3 tiers of hotpot: value, house special, premium vip (see image for pricing and more details). They have a good selection of sodas and their own in-house beverages, I strongly recommend the taro milk tea and the honeydew milk tea.

They offer a vast and very fresh selection of appetizers, vegetables, noodles, seafoods, and proteins. Items were restocked quickly and frequently during our peak dinner time visit.

Staff were prompt to bring the beef whenever we ordered and were on top of refilling our soup. Great experience all around.

Pretty good AYCE affordable option in Flushing. With tip included itâ€™s about $38 per person for the house special option and we went on a weekend. Doesnâ€™t come with ice cream like in the VIP tier unfortunately

Good value Hot Pot.  Inviting and friendly staff.  Buffet area was small but had everything packed in.  Also sauce area was small and limited, no ice cream machine either.  They meat was delicious, also they offered fish filets in buffet area that were delicate and very fresh.  Garlic beef was marinated well, and lean beef were our two favorites.  I would dine again and try a different broth.  All you can eat within 90 mins!!!

AYCE Hot Pot for $24.95 ğŸ˜‹

Happy Lamb Hot Pot is a Mongolian hot pot spot in Flushing that serves delicious broths, meats, seafood, vegetables, sauces & other options to choose from! Their AYCE lunch special from 12pm-3pm is $24.95!

This deal includes:
Choice of any broth
Unlimited hot pot meat
Unlimited buffet access
Unlimited sauce & cold bar
Unlimited Soda Refills

Iâ€™ve been wanting to try hot pot for the longest time but I just never get around to it but I finally did! This was a steal deal & such a great experience! The best of both worlds broth was the best! Loved the house special meat selection! You can upgrade to Premium VIP meat selection for a few more bucks!

Spacious & clean atmosphere & the service is attentive! Great mix of quality & affordability.

Happy Lamb Hot Pot is a fantastic dining experience! The food is delicious, with a wide selection of fresh ingredients that cater to all tastes. The service is excellentâ€”friendly staff who are attentive and helpful.

What really impressed me was the reasonable pricing. You get all-you-can-eat options at a great value, making it perfect for anyone looking to indulge without overspending.

Overall, I highly recommend Happy Lamb Hot Pot for a satisfying meal!

After a month of hard work, my team and I decided to unwind at Happy Lamb Shabu Shabu in Flushing. It was the perfect choice! The cozy atmosphere, delicious food, and friendly service made our evening truly enjoyable. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a relaxing dining experience!

We did the VIP experience because it was our first time there but next time we will go with the standard because the quality of their buffet items were fantastic! Been to many hot pots before but this is definitely my new favorite for a great mix of quality & affordability. Glad everyone else has given such detailed reviews! Also drinks were as cheap as you can get in this city.

It is the best AYCE hotpot in Flushing! From the meat (angus quality) and its buffet choices of unlimited shrimp,  calamari, fish, clams, vegetables etc all of them are fresh. Including free flow sodas. Undoubtedly reasonable price per person for all you can eat. One thing I like the most this place uses chicken broth. Fine service, waitresses always look out for customers and give great services though the restaurant busy. They have 3 packages All You Can Eat: Value, House Special & Premium. I always pick House Special AYCE, best deal! For weekdays lunch $24.95, dinner $26.95 and weekends $28.95. Has a very clean family restroom and designated parking space a block away. Itâ€™s my family only AYCE hotpot to go in Flushing!

Four star Because the spicy soup base is not spicy at all. The beef slice and lamb slice are amazing, They are so thin. If you don't waste food at the end, They will charge you few dollars less per person. All other foods are fine. The pot If you don't set to 15+ or 20max, it is very difficult to have your soup boil. I like their restaurant setup. It looks neat.

Cozy AYCE hotpot spot. The broth was decently flavored, service was quick, and meat was pretty fresh. Of note, there is a 90 minute time limit and the pot is family-style so if anyone is uncomfortable sharing food, this is not the place for you.

The vegetable bar had great selection and there's the bonus of unlimited soda.

The largest tables we saw seated 6 people but this is a cozy spot best enjoyed by couples or small groups generally (3-4 people). Overall, worth returning to. 9/10

Good hotpot location. Used to be called Little Sheep. Service was alright. Food is good. Plenty of food options to choose from. Not too many sauce variety. Price is reasonable. Plenty of seats. Bathroom available.
Happy Lamb Hot Pot æ˜¯ä¸€å®¶å—æ­¡è¿çš„ç«é‹é¤å»³ï¼Œä»¥å…¶é«˜å“è³ªçš„è‚‰é¡å’Œæ–°é®®çš„é£Ÿæè‘—ç¨±ï¼Œæä¾›å¤šç¨®æ¹¯åº•å’Œé…æ–™é¸æ“‡ï¼Œæ˜¯èšé¤å’Œäº«å—ç¾é£Ÿçš„å¥½åœ°æ–¹ã€‚ğŸ²ğŸ‘ğŸ¥¢
Their lunch buffet is sooooo worth it. AYCE for under 30 bucks. I love all their meat they were very tasty and the soup is fresh. Donâ€™t recommend the seafood tho they were kinda mid

Happy Lamb Hot Pot is a hidden gem in Flushing, Queens. This popular hot pot restaurant offers a wide variety of meats, vegetables, and broths to choose from, so you can create a meal that is tailored to your taste buds.

The meat selection is particularly impressive, with a variety of beef, lamb, pork, chicken, and seafood options available. The meats are all cooked to perfection in the hot pot broth, and they are incredibly tender and flavorful.

Great price for weekday ayce hot pot! Great selection of veggies and noodles. Also interesting selection of seafood and some cow internals. Typical sauce station but nice option for open access to fountain drinks.

I came twice before the renovation and once more after. After the renovation, the system has changed, but it is still great! The servers are all polite, patient, and helpful. My friend and I did not know that we were supposed to inform the servers of our coupon ahead of time, but they still helped us cashed it in. Even when the  place is crowded, they routinely come by to refill the hotpot. The buffet have a self-service table where you can get seafood, pasta, vegetables, and other side dishes. The meat were filling and tasty. The only thing you need to watch out is the timing. While they do not specify a time limit, you generally have between 2-2.5 hours as a time limit. Other AYCE places may extend to 3 hours, but here is slightly shorter. Still highly recommend as the foods and services were all great!
